title: Two sums of money are proportional to 8:13. If the first sum is Rs. 96, what is the addition of the two sums? - Quora

response.answer_text: I won't give you a long explanation. If you multiple 8 with 12 then you get 96.So, multiply 12 with 13, which will be your second number. 12*13=156 S Answer: 96+156=252
